content: algerian love knot lariat materials needed dmc embroidery floss #451 dark shell grey dmc embroidery floss #453 light shell grey 3 25 mm crochet hook d directions with darker shade ch12 1 join with a slip_stitch to first stitch to form a ring chain 1 2 single_crochet 26 into ring and join with a slip_stitch to first single_crochet tie off with lighter shade 3 join in any stitch from step 2 4 working around the circle counter clockwise single_crochet in next 2 stitches 2 half_double_crochet in each of next 5 stitches single_crochet in next 2 stitches slip_stitch in next 4 stitches single_crochet in next 2 stitches 2 half_double_crochet in each of next 5 stitches single_crochet in next 2 stitches slip_stitch in next 4 stitches join with a slip_stitch to first single_crochet and tie off with darker shade 5 to make second ring using darker shade chain 12 weave through first ring to link should look like the links of a chain before joining with a slip_stitch to first stitch to form a ring as in step 1 chain 1 6 repeat step 2 7 repeat step 3 8 repeat step 4 you now have 2 interlocking rings form the knot two interlocking rings to lie flat in a pseudo square shape 9 working counter clockwise around the shape join the darker shade in the first half_double_crochet working counter clockwise around a loop 10 single_crochet in each half_double_crochet for the loop 10 stitches chain 1 join in the first half_double_crochet of the next loop still working counter clockwise in both the loops and the overall shape single_crochet in each of the next 10 half_double_crochet chain 1 join in the first half_double_crochet of the next loop single_crochet in each of the next 10 half_double_crochet chain 1 join in the first half_double_crochet of the next loop single_crochet in each of the next 10 half_double_crochet chain 1 join with a slip_stitch to first single_crochet do not tie off 11 chain 126 12 single_crochet in second chain from hook and in next 124 stitches join with a slip_stitch to last stitch from step 10 tie off and weave in ends thread the 125 stitch rope through the hole in the center of the knot to wear as a lariat type necklace special notes i recommend having a smaller crochet hook i used a 1 75 mm hook to help you to easily weave in the ends i also recommend trying to hide as many of the ends as possible in your stitches as in tapestry crochet as you go along this creates less work for you later this pattern is copyright 2008 by nichole m verville this pattern is not to be sold except with permission from me you may sell the finished product
